title: Trump blew lid off illusion, Modi nowhere to be seen: Rahul as bourses plunge over tariff turmoil
story_summary: Rahul Gandhi criticized PM Modi's handling of the economy after stock markets crashed due to US tariff hikes on April 7, 2025. He stated India must build a resilient, production-based economy. The Sensex plunged 2,226.79 points, its steepest decline in 10 months, amid global market turmoil. Gandhi accused Modi of being "nowhere to be seen" while the economy faces challenges. All Sensex shares, except Hindustan Unilever, experienced losses. The market decline reflects fears of an economic slowdown sparked by US-China trade tensions.

title: Video of Kuno staff offering cheetahs water: KNP begins inquiry over staff indiscipline, violation of norms
story_summary: Kuno National Park (KNP) initiated disciplinary action after a video surfaced of staff offering water to cheetahs. The incident violated instructions and showed indiscipline, according to officials. The video depicted a staff member giving water to a cheetah and her four cubs in the Agra range. The KNP monitoring team had instructions to lure the cheetahs back into the forest to prevent human-animal conflict. Authorities emphasized only authorized personnel should approach cheetahs for specific tasks.

title: Nirmala Sitharaman to visit the U.K., Austria from April 8
story_summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will visit the U.K. and Austria from April 8-13, 2025. She will participate in the 13th India-U.K. Economic and Financial Dialogue (EFD), co-chaired with Rachel Reeves. Priorities include cooperation in IFSC GIFT City, investment, FinTech, and climate finance. Sitharaman will launch reports and initiatives, meet dignitaries, and attend investor roundtables. In Austria, she will meet government leaders and Austrian CEOs to discuss investment opportunities. The visit aims to enhance financial collaboration between India, the U.K., and Austria.

title: BJP tops list of national parties with over ₹2,243 crore in donations in FY 2023-24: ADR
story_summary: The BJP received ₹2,243 crore in donations in FY 2023-24, topping the list of national parties, according to an ADR report. This accounts for 88% of the total ₹2,544.28 crore donated to national parties. The Congress received ₹281.48 crore. Donations to the BJP increased by 211.72% from the previous year. Corporate/business sectors donated ₹2,262.55 crore, while individual donors contributed ₹270.872 crore. The Prudent Electoral Trust was the top donor, contributing ₹723.675 crore to the BJP.

title: Myanmar at crossroads: crisis, aid and fight for stability
story_summary: A 7.7-magnitude earthquake devastated Mandalay, Myanmar, killing at least 2,000 and leaving many homeless amidst ongoing internal conflict. Over 40% of Myanmar's territory is outside military control since the 2021 coup. The earthquake complicates aid delivery, as military leadership controls the affected region. International actors face challenges in providing aid independently. Civil society organizations are weak due to military rule. ASEAN and regional actors are expected to play a critical role in coordinating relief efforts. The disaster highlights the need for a collective approach to humanitarian aid.

title: Badlapur sexual assault case: HC directs FIR against cops responsible for custodial death of accused, orders SIT probe
story_summary: The Bombay High Court directed the Maharashtra government to register an FIR against five policemen for the custodial death of Akshay Shinde, accused in the Badlapur school sexual assault case. The court ordered a special investigation team (SIT) to probe the case. Shinde allegedly died from police gunfire on September 23, 2024. A magistrate's report indicated the incident was a fake encounter. The court criticized the government's reluctance to file an FIR, undermining faith in the justice system.

title: Supreme Court junks plea for 100% manual counting of VVPAT slips during polls
story_summary: The Supreme Court dismissed a plea seeking 100% manual counting of VVPAT slips in addition to electronic counting. The bench, led by CJI Sanjiv Khanna, upheld the Delhi High Court's previous judgment on the issue.  The plea was filed by Hans Raj Jain against the Delhi High Court's August 12, 2024, judgment. The CJI noted that a similar bench had previously addressed these issues. The Supreme Court reaffirmed that EVMs are safe, simple, and user-friendly.

title: Railways land-for-jobs 'scam': Supreme Court refuses to hear ED's plea against bail to Lalu aide
story_summary: The Supreme Court refused to hear the ED's plea against bail granted to Lalu Prasad Yadav's aide, Amit Katyal, in the land-for-jobs scam. The bench questioned why the ED targeted only "small flies" while main persons remain unarrested. Katyal was granted bail by the Delhi High Court on September 17, citing a "pick and choose" policy by the ED. The High Court noted no other accused had been arrested and Katyal joined the investigation. The ED claims Katyal helped Yadav acquire land.

title: IUML moves Supreme Court against Waqf Amendment Act of 2025
story_summary: The Indian Union Muslim League (IUML) has moved the Supreme Court against the Waqf (Amendment) Act of 2025.  The IUML argues the amendments fundamentally alter Waqf governance and protection, violating Articles 14, 15, 25, and 26 of the Constitution. The party claims the amendments impose arbitrary restrictions, enhance state control, and deviate from the religious essence of Waqf.  The IUML seeks legal remedy to protect the Waqf Act, calling the amendment an attempt to curtail Muslim rights.

title: Manipur cumulatively spent over six years under President’s Rule: Graphics
story_summary: Manipur is currently under President's Rule, imposed on February 13, 2025, after the CM's resignation. This marks the 11th instance of President's Rule in Manipur since 1967. Cumulatively, Manipur has spent six and a half years under President's Rule, ranking fourth among all States and UTs. Jammu and Kashmir tops the list with almost 15 years under President's Rule. The resolution confirming the imposition was adopted by the Rajya Sabha on April 4 and by the Lok Sabha on April 3.

title: Two murder accused, cop, injured in encounter in Meerut
story_summary: Two murder accused, Chhagga alias Balveer and Fauta alias Manmeet, were injured in an encounter with police in Meerut's Hastinapur area. A head constable, Tarun Malik, also sustained a gunshot wound. The encounter occurred during a routine check when the accused attempted to flee on a motorcycle. Police seized a .32-bore pistol and a .315-bore revolver. The accused were involved in the murder of Parmjeet Singh on April 2 and each carried a reward of ₹25,000.

title: Markets reacting predictably in 'tariffying' manner: Senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh
story_summary: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh criticized PM Modi over the stock market crash, attributing it to "self-inflicted wounds" from reciprocal tariffs, similar to demonetization. Stock market indices crashed following Trump's tariff hikes.  The Sensex fell over 5%, and the Nifty tumbled 5.06%. Ramesh likened Modi and Trump as experts in harming their economies. Asian markets also experienced significant declines. Ramesh stated markets were reacting predictably to the trade war fears.

title: Supreme Court collegium recommends transfer of Madhya Pradesh HC Judge to Kerala HC
story_summary: The Supreme Court collegium recommended the transfer of Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari from the Madhya Pradesh High Court to the Kerala High Court. The collegium, headed by Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna, made the recommendation after meetings held on March 20, March 24, and April 3, 2025. The recommendation was uploaded on the Supreme Court's website. No specific reason was provided for the transfer.

title: CJI says lawyers’ requests for urgent listing of Waqf Act challenge to be placed before him in the afternoon
story_summary: CJI Sanjiv Khanna said petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025 will be listed for hearing in due course. Written requests will be reviewed and assigned to benches. Advocates highlighted the need for an early hearing. Petitions argue the Act infringes on Muslim rights by imposing arbitrary restrictions and state control, violating Articles 14, 15, 25, and 26. DMK contends it affects 50 lakh Muslims in Tamil Nadu. The IUML claims the amendments alter Waqf governance and protection, undermining religious autonomy.
